title: Where does Milton Williams rank among Patriots’ 10 best free-agent signings ever?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Milton Williams ranked eighth in Patriots' best free-agent signings after signing a $104 million contract in 2025.
Williams recorded 5.5 sacks during the regular and postseason, contributing significantly to the Patriots' Super Bowl LX run.
Williams' 13.7 pass rush win rate is eighth among defensive tackles, missing five games showed his importance to the Patriots.

title: 8 lesser discussed potential trade deadline candidates that could make sense for Celtics
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Celtics unlikely to make major trades before Thursday's NBA deadline, targeting lesser-known candidates.
Potential targets include Nets center Nic Claxton and Mavericks center Daniel Gafford, focusing on defensive reinforcements.
Celtics also considering Kings guard Keon Ellis and Pelicans center Yyves Missi to complement their roster.

title: Something in the Way Fest 2026: Live updates from Roadrunner
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: The Something in the Way festival at Boston's Roadrunner features indie and alt-rock bands on January 31 and February 1, 2026.
The festival is hosted by Run for Cover Records and The Bowery Presents, with performances from two dozen bands on a two-stage setup.
Philadelphia band Her New Knife and solo artist Graham Hunt shared political messages during their performances on the festival's first day.

title: Why the Bruins practiced in a tent on Saturday in Florida
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Bruins practiced inside a giant tent at Raymond James Stadium to maintain ice conditions before the outdoor game.
The NHL erected a 34-foot-high tent over the rink to regulate temperature and humidity amid Florida's elements.
Sunday's expected high in Tampa is 49°F, with colder temperatures forecasted for the evening outdoor game.

title: Boston ‘ICE Out Everywhere’ protest must-see moments
author: Annie Jonas and Samantha Genzer
bullets: Thousands gathered at Boston Common for 'ICE Out Everywhere' protest against ICE cooperation and for immigrant community protections.
The protest, organized by multiple local advocacy groups, was part of a national campaign across 300 cities.
Participants called for nonviolent resistance, and legislative accountability; no major incidents reported during the event.

title: Photos from Boston’s ‘ICE Out Everywhere’ protest
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Over a thousand people protested Trump's immigration policies at Boston Common in 15-degree weather on January 31, 2026.
The 'ICE Out Everywhere' event, organized by Mass 50501, is part of a series of protests following the 'National Shutdown'.
Protesters gathered at the State House steps with signs and messages opposing ICE, including a dog with an anti-ICE sign.

title: Insider believes Red Sox have ‘another move in them’ this offseason to improve infield
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox may pursue another infielder ahead of 2026 season, prioritizing defense over power, says insider Jeff Passan.
Isaac Paredes and Christian Walker speculated as targets, but fit uncertainties remain, especially for Walker at first base.
Red Sox exploring Marcelo Mayer, Romy Gonzalez, and David Hamilton for infield roles if no trade materializes.

title: Even Drake Maye’s dad is surprised by Patriots’ Super Bowl run
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The New England Patriots, led by quarterback Drake Maye, advance to Super Bowl LX after a surprising season.
Drake Maye's father, Mark Maye, acknowledged surprise at the Patriots' Super Bowl run despite preseason hope for playoffs.
Quarterback Drake Maye led the league in completion percentage and passer rating, contributing significantly to the team's 14-3 record.

title: That guy on TV, Cris Collinsworth, will look familiar to Patriots fans tuning into NBC to watch the Super Bowl
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Cris Collinsworth will call Super Bowl LX on NBC with Mike Tirico, marking his fourth Patriots game broadcast this season.
Collinsworth has broadcasted five Patriots Super Bowl appearances, including the previous matchup with the Seahawks 11 seasons ago.
The Patriots' season featured key wins with Collinsworth as an analyst, highlighting their evolving offense and strong defensive performances.

title: Mass. snowplow driver who spotted legs sticking out of snowbank praised for saving older man
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Snowplow driver Matte McGarry saved an older man trapped in a snowbank during a storm in Auburn, Massachusetts.
McGarry spotted flailing legs while plowing near Worcester–Auburn, stopped to rescue the man stuck in 3-feet-deep snow.
The Auburn Board of Selectmen plans to commend McGarry for his quick actions that potentially saved the man's life.
